content: hey jeremy guy from midwinter minis here i love your fantasy builds but you know
me i'm a 40k fanatic i challenge you to
make some grim dark sci-fi terrain but here's a twist we are only allowed
to use water pistols and toy guns i mean you can use glue too
and paint i suppose anyway let's do this good luck lots of love guy ps
i hope you enjoy losing
well he didn't say how many i could use
so
so
okay i gotta tell you guys that the last hour or so of working has been real
poopy i cut out all these mdf bases and i was
using my scroll saw in the basement and it broke
like broke beyond repair so that sucked
i finished off cutting them off with the jigsaw which is really awkward and
annoying but it works took them outside to sand
all the edges with an orbital sander and an extreme
thunderstorm came rolling in so i try to quickly do it in the tiny
little overhang of the roof my room still smells like
burning plastic from dremeling all these pieces
i had the crazy exhaust fan going open window all that but it still
is a bit stinky now it's time to actually mount all these to the bases
i'm going to hot glue them in place and then i'm going to need some kind of
modeling compound to build it up i'm all out of sculpt mold which is what i would
normally use and amazon is still sold out of
sculpt mold thankfully i have some really wonderful
friends specifically my friend luke from luke's aps
geek gaming he hooked me up he sent me a bag of his
modeling compound to try out came yesterday so
just in time to do this project he also sent me a whole bunch of his
bass ready stuff which i may or may not use on these i don't know
they'll get used eventually but for now let's attach these things put on the
modeling compound
so
so
while i finish airbrushing out these bases i need to take a moment to share
with you the sponsor of this week's video
easy roller dice company has launched another kickstarter for a new style of
super cool gaming dice this time around they've gone for a
crazy color spray effect maybe you want to get a theme set to
match your favorite rpg character or maybe your game master and you'd like to
get a whole bunch of damage dice in a blood splattered red well you can do
that if you want to get a whole bunch of d6s
or d12s or d whatevers you can select just a bunch of those diced in any of
the cool colors i'll put a link in the video description
below so you can check them out and grab a set for yourself or maybe consider
grabbing a set as a gift for one of your fellow players
or your favorite game master thanks easy roller for helping me bring
another cool build video to my viewers okay it is day two here and day one was
a pretty big success i got quite a bit done and actually i
probably could have finished the last step on these if i hadn't messed around
with so many unnecessary painting steps if i were to do this again
and have a better plan i could probably bang these out start to finish in one
day you might notice this one here is not
painted up like the rest and this one well it didn't even get
primed i realized i didn't like them this one
really just looked like gun handles and i don't know it just i wasn't
feeling it so i didn't bother this one here you know i wanted to use
as much of the water guns as possible but it really has this weird 1950s
retro buck rogers look that just isn't grim dark to me i don't like it so
i didn't continue with it i'm gonna put it aside maybe
i'll end up modifying it and using it for something in the future
now the final step is to add the actual sand flocking to this and like i said my
buddy luke sent me a bunch of his base ready stuff and he does have two
that are desert sand and stone but it's pretty big aggregate and
there's not necessarily enough to do the whole thing
i also want to try to make the bases sort of match this
battle mat that i have here so what i'm gonna do is use
the same sort of method that i used when i did my mandalorian diorama and use
unsanded grout but i'm gonna mix in some of this aggregate here
and yeah hopefully it should give me a pretty nice look
so
all right i think i nailed this challenge come on
i mean i used basically nothing other than the water pistols yeah i used some
material to base them but for the actual structures we just straight up only the
water pistols i didn't add any other bit 3d printed parts nothing nada just the
dollar store water guns and i'm pretty damn happy with how well they
turned out this is a good project and i'm really glad that a guy from
midwinter minis challenged me to do so if you're not familiar with guy's
channel it's confusing his name is guy and he's also a guy midwinter minis he
does mostly warhammer related focused
painting videos as well as some other general warhammer hobby stuff but
even if you don't play warhammer which i don't really
you need a lot of great information from his videos he's got
really spectacular painting videos he's got some terrain building videos he
should be also doing this challenge and he should
have a water pistol challenge i hope he didn't show me up because he also has
some good terrain building videos on his channel
overall he's a cool guy he's a rad human being
and he's also the king of tackling huge painting projects in a really
rational and calm way getting a lot done in a short period of time so
we'll see how i fared up against him i bought a couple different water pistols
not knowing you know how it would turn out and i
found that some certainly worked better than others i found that the ones that
had more kind of square lines on them ended up looking a lot
better than the ones that had that really
rounded kind of buck rogers look to them i would recommend
getting ones like that i actually went and bought a few more today
because i found that this one was really really good it had tons of
cool little details on it and made this one which is my favorite one and if i
want to do more i wanted to have a couple of these on hand
these are pretty simple thing to build but they do require
a rotary tool i don't think there's a great way to cut these
without one you're going to need a rotary tool and a lot of
replacement discs because they will break throughout the project
i guess if you have a lot of time you can just hand saw it but you're
certainly not cutting these with a utility knife
it would be really sketchy to do if you got a rotary tool you got a lot of water
guns you can bang out a table's worth of this
scatter train in like a day it's pretty crazy i always just wing it when
i'm doing paints and i don't plan ahead as much as i should because i'm i'm not
guy over mid winter minis i just i just wing it in hindsight i definitely
would have applied the texture effect the rusty vallejo
texture paste before priming next time it would have made far more sense
and when i got it to that point where i dry brushed on the metallics
the pieces look pretty good and that's a place you could leave them if you don't
have an airbrush and you don't want to move into
all the airbrushing of inks that i did after that you could just spray paint it
brown do some washes dry brush with a dark metallic and be
done with it and get a nice futuristic kind of sci-fi look
i wanted more of that mad max style desert look which is why i
then switched gears did the hairspray paint chipping technique and all the
sepia washes because i really like this sort of scheme and it really
matches my base well that's partially also why i airbrushed
the grout on the sand afterwards rather than
leaving it that light yellow because i wanted it to have that really orangey
mad max kind of look and again to match this particular battle mat that
i have one of the other reasons i airbrushed it is because there were some
spots where i missed with my grout the glue i used
is geek gaming glue i'll tell you right now you might have seen luke use it a
bunch of times this fast drying basin glue and a lot of
people comment saying that's just pva having worked with it it is absolutely
not just pva this stuff is a totally different
kind of glue it dries super tacky like it doesn't
harden and dry the way pva glue does it stays
tacky and sticky and in places where i missed it was shiny
and very tacky i could have glued static grass to those spots if i wanted and
that was after a day of drying so i sincerely hope you enjoyed this video
if you did hit the like button let me know in the comment section below
big thank you to easy roller for sponsoring this video check out their
kickstarter link will be in the video description also thanks to my buddy luke
from geek gaming for hooking me up with some product that i desperately
needed to complete this if you want to pick up any tools and
supplies for your own build first head to the dollar store get some water
pistols uh and then check out blackmagiccraft.ca they have my
essential equipment page where i explain and link to all of the
stuff that i use regularly if you enjoy these videos i
make and you want to help me keep making them the best way you can do that is by
supporting the channel on patreon throwing a few bucks to the
channel every month allows me to do these crazy things
like take a bunch of water pistols and build some kind of ridiculous
terrain this is my job it's totally silly
and i love the fact that it is that way so thank you to all my patreon
supporters that's it for this week guys see you
again next week cheers
and
